wikipedia_page.main: Alec Brader  (born 6 October 1942) is an English professional footballer, schoolteacher and youth athletics coach who played as an inside forward. Following his football career he became a schoolteacher teaching Physical Education, Geography and European Studies, spending most of his career at William Lovell Academy where he eventually became Deputy Headmaster. He also volunteered as a youth athletics coach for Lincolnshire teams for over 40 years. For the Easter time he organized and went on tour with the Lincs Schools F.A. to the tri-border area of the Netherlands, Germany and Belgium. The youth soccer players took part in international soccer tournaments and friendly matches. For his services to "young people" he was made a Member of the Order of the British Empire in 2009 New Years Honours list.
